com.digi.xbee.api.packet

Class XBeeAPIPacket

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.digi.xbee.api.packet.XBeePacket
      • com.digi.xbee.api.packet.XBeeAPIPacket
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ATCommandPacket, ATCommandQueuePacket, ATCommandResponsePacket, ExplicitAddressingPacket, ExplicitRxIndicatorPacket, GenericXBeePacket, IODataSampleRxIndicatorPacket, ModemStatusPacket, ReceivePacket, RemoteATCommandPacket, RemoteATCommandResponsePacket, RX16IOPacket, RX16Packet, RX64IOPacket, RX64Packet, TransmitPacket, TransmitStatusPacket, TX16Packet, TX64Packet, TXStatusPacket, UnknownXBeePacket

    public abstract class XBeeAPIPacket
extends XBeePacket
    This abstract class provides the basic structure of a ZigBee API frame.

    Derived classes should implement their own methods to generate the API data and frame ID in case they support it.

    Basic operations such as frame type retrieval are performed in this class.

    See Also:
    XBeePacket

    • Field Detail

      • NO_FRAME_ID

        public static final int NO_FRAME_ID
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • checkFrameID

        public boolean checkFrameID(int id)
        Returns whether the given ID is the current frame ID.
        Parameters:
        id - The frame id to check.
        Returns:
        true if frame ID is equal to the id provided, false otherwise or if the frame does not need an ID.
        See Also:
        getFrameID(), needsAPIFrameID(), setFrameID(int)

      • getAPIData

        public byte[] getAPIData()
        Returns the XBee API packet data.

        This does not include the frame ID if it is needed.

        Returns:
        The XBee API packet data.

      • getFrameID

        public int getFrameID()
        Returns the Frame ID of the API packet.

        If the frame ID is not configured or if the API packet does not need a Frame ID (if (!needsAPIFrameID())) this method returns NO_FRAME_ID (9999).

        Returns:
        The frame ID.
        See Also:
        NO_FRAME_ID, needsAPIFrameID(), setFrameID(int)

      • getFrameType

        public APIFrameType getFrameType()
        Returns the XBee packet frame type. If APIFrameType#UNKNOWN is returned, the real value of the frame type is returned by #getFrameTypeValue().
        Returns:
        The XBee packet frame type.
        See Also:
        APIFrameType

      • getFrameTypeValue

        public int getFrameTypeValue()
        Returns the XBee packet frame type integer value.
        Returns:
        The XBee packet frame type integer value.

      • getPacketData

        public byte[] getPacketData()
        Description copied from class: XBeePacket
        Returns the packet data.
        Specified by:
        getPacketData in class XBeePacket
        Returns:
        The packet data.

      • isBroadcast

        public abstract boolean isBroadcast()
        Returns whether or not the packet is a broadcast packet.
        Returns:
        true if the packet is a broadcast packet, false otherwise.

      • needsAPIFrameID

        public abstract boolean needsAPIFrameID()
        Returns whether the API packet needs API Frame ID or not.
        Returns:
        true if the packet needs API Frame ID, false otherwise.

      • setFrameID

        public void setFrameID(int frameID)
        Sets the frame ID of the API packet.

        If the API packet does not need a frame ID (if (!needsAPIFrameID())), this method does nothing.

        Parameters:
        frameID - The frame ID to set.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if frameID < 0 or if frameID > 255.
        See Also:
        getFrameID()
